error.access-token-error: Unable to obtain access token from multirpc-sdk

chains.title: Choose Your Network
chains.archive-tooltip-text: Archived Mode makes it possible to reference a complete history of data kept on full nodes stretching back to the genesis block. This is necessary to complete queries to a distant historical state, such as a past account balance at block #4,000,000. It is especially useful for services like block explorers, wallet vendors, and chain analytics.

banner.dashboard:
If your volume exceeds 1M daily requests, our enterprise-grade service is for you.
Contact us and switch to fast, secure, and dedicated infrastructure. Contact sales@ankr.com

header.private-endpoints-tooltip: Use Provider URL as your main API endpoint for development. Do not use "My Endpoints" directly.
header.public-endpoints-tooltip: Use Provider URL as your main API endpoint for development.

about-tron.about: The new TronGrid REST API provides user-friendly read APIs with significantly reduced latency, improved consistency, improved availability, and added partition tolerance.

no-data.title: Send your request
no-data.content: Once you start sending requests, your activity will be visible here.

method-description.web3_sha3: Returns Keccak-256 (not the standardized SHA3-256) of the given data.
method-description.net_listening: Returns `true` if client is actively listening for network connections.
method-description.net_peerCount: Returns number of peers currently connected to the client.
method-description.eth_protocolVersion: Returns the current ethereum protocol version.
method-description.eth_syncing: Returns an object with data about the sync status or false.
method-description.eth_mining: Returns `true` if client is actively mining new blocks.
method-description.eth_hashrate: Returns the number of hashes per second that the node is mining with.
method-description.eth_gasPrice: Returns the current price per gas in wei.
method-description.eth_accounts: Returns a list of addresses owned by client.
method-description.eth_blockNumber: Returns the number of most recent block.
method-description.eth_getBalance: Returns the balance of the account of given address.
method-description.eth_getStorageAt: Returns the value from a storage position at a given address.
method-description.eth_getTransactionCount: Returns the number of transactions sent from an address.
method-description.eth_getBlockTransactionCountByHash: Returns the number of transactions in a block from a block matching the given block hash.
method-description.eth_getBlockTransactionCountByNumber: Returns the number of transactions in a block matching the given block number.
method-description.eth_getUncleCountByBlockHash: Returns the number of uncles in a block from a block matching the given block hash.
method-description.eth_getUncleCountByBlockNumber: Returns the number of uncles in a block from a block matching the given block number.
method-description.eth_getCode: Returns code at a given address.
method-description.eth_sign: ðŸš« This method is not supported!
method-description.eth_signTransaction: ðŸš« This method is not supported!
method-description.eth_sendTransaction: ðŸš« This method is not supported!
method-description.eth_sendRawTransaction: Creates new message call transaction or a contract creation for signed transactions.
method-description.eth_call: Call any read-only function on a deployed contract
method-description.eth_estimateGas: ðŸš« This method is not YET supported!
method-description.eth_getBlockByHash: Returns information about a block by hash.
method-description.eth_getBlockByNumber: Returns information about a block by block number.
method-description.eth_getTransactionByHash: Returns the information about a transaction requested by transaction hash.
method-description.eth_getTransactionByBlockHashAndIndex: Returns information about a transaction by block hash and transaction index position.
method-description.eth_getTransactionByBlockNumberAndIndex: Returns information about a transaction by block number and transaction index position.
method-description.eth_getTransactionReceipt: Returns the receipt of a transaction by transaction hash.
method-description.eth_getUncleByBlockHashAndIndex: Returns information about a uncle of a block by hash and uncle index position.
method-description.eth_getUncleByBlockNumberAndIndex: Returns information about a uncle of a block by number and uncle index position.
method-description.eth_getCompilers: Returns a list of available compilers in the client.
method-description.eth_newFilter: Creates a filter object, based on filter options, to notify when the state changes (logs).  The resulting value from the filter is immediately returned using `eth_getFilterChanges`.
method-description.eth_newBlockFilter: Creates a filter in the node, to notify when a new block arrives. The resulting value from the filter is immediately returned using `eth_getFilterChanges`.
method-description.eth_newPendingTransactionFilter: Creates a filter in the node, to notify when new pending transactions arrive. The resulting value from the filter is immediately returned using `eth_getFilterChanges`.
method-description.eth_uninstallFilter: ðŸš« This method is not YET supported!
method-description.eth_getFilterChanges: This method is covered by eth_newFilter, eth_newBlockFilter and eth_newPendingTransactionFilter.
method-description.eth_getFilterLogs: This method is covered by eth_newFilter, eth_newBlockFilter and eth_newPendingTransactionFilter.
method-description.eth_getLogs: This method is covered by eth_newFilter, eth_newBlockFilter and eth_newPendingTransactionFilter.
method-description.eth_getWork: Returns the hash of the current block, the seedHash, and the boundary condition to be met ('target').
method-description.trace_block: Returns traces created at given block (OpenEthereum or Parity only).
method-description.trace_transaction: Returns all traces of given transaction (OpenEthereum or Parity only).
method-description.trace_get: Returns trace at given position (OpenEthereum or Parity only).
method-description.trace_rawTransaction: Traces a call to `eth_sendRawTransaction` without making the call, returning the traces.
method-description.trace_replayBlockTransactions: Replays all transactions in a block returning the requested traces for each transaction.
method-description.trace_replayTransaction: Replays a transaction, returning the traces.
method-description.trace_call: Executes the given call and returns a number of possible traces for it.

c-chain.getAtomicTx: Returns the transaction data of a provided transaction ID by calling the node's `getAtomicTx` method.
c-chain.export: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>Export an asset from the C-Chain to X-Chain or P-Chain. After calling this method, you must call the X-Chain's avm.import or P-Chain's platform.import
c-chain.exportAVAX: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>DEPRECATEDâ€”instead use avax.export.
c-chain.exportKey: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>Get the private key that controls a given address. The returned private key can be added to a user with avax.importKey.
c-chain.getUTXOs: Retrieves the UTXOs related to the addresses provided from the node's `getUTXOs` method.
c-chain.import: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>Finalize the transfer of a non-AVAX or AVAX from X-Chain or P-Chain to the C-Chain. Before this method is called, you must call the X-Chainâ€™s avm.export or P-Chainâ€™s platform.exportAVAX with assetID AVAX to initiate the transfer.
c-chain.importAVAX: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>DEPRECATEDâ€”instead use avax.import
c-chain.importKey: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>Give a user control over an address by providing the private key that controls the address.
c-chain.issueTx: Calls the node's issueTx method from the API and returns the resulting transaction ID as a string.
c-chain.getAtomicTxStatus: Returns the status of a provided atomic transaction ID by calling the node's `getAtomicTxStatus` method.

p-chain.addDelegator: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>Add a delegator to the Primary Network.
p-chain.addValidator: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>Add a validator to the Primary Network.
p-chain.addSubnetValidator: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>Add a validator to a Subnet other than the Primary Network.
p-chain.createAddress: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>Create a new address controlled by the given user.
p-chain.createBlockchain: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>Create a new blockchain.
p-chain.createSubnet: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>Create a new Subnet.
p-chain.exportAVAX: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>Send AVAX from an address on the P-Chain to an address on the X-Chain or C-Chain.
p-chain.exportKey: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>Get the private key that controls a given address.
p-chain.getBalance: Get the balance of AVAX controlled by a given address.
p-chain.getBlockchains: Get all the blockchains that exist (excluding the P-Chain).
p-chain.getBlockchainStatus: Get the status of a blockchain.
p-chain.getCurrentSupply: Returns an upper bound on the number of AVAX that exist.
p-chain.getCurrentValidators: List the current validators of the given Subnet.
p-chain.getHeight: Returns the height of the last accepted block.
p-chain.getMaxStakeAmount: Returns the maximum amount of nAVAX staking to the named node during a particular time period.
p-chain.getMinStake: Get the minimum amount of AVAX required to validate the Primary Network and the minimum amount of AVAX that can be delegated.
p-chain.getPendingValidators: List the validators in the pending validator set of the specified Subnet. Each validator is not currently validating the Subnet but will in the future.
p-chain.getRewardUTXOs: Returns the UTXOs that were rewarded after the provided transaction's staking or delegation period ended.
p-chain.getStakingAssetID: Retrieve an assetID for a subnetâ€™s staking asset. Currently, this only returns the Primary Networkâ€™s staking assetID.
p-chain.getStake: Get the amount of nAVAX staked by a set of addresses. The amount returned does not include staking rewards.
p-chain.getTotalStake: Get the total amount of nAVAX staked on the Primary Network.
p-chain.getTx: Gets a transaction by its ID.
p-chain.getTxStatus: Gets a transactionâ€™s status by its ID.
p-chain.getUTXOs: Gets the UTXOs that reference a given set of addresses.
p-chain.getValidatorsAt: Get the validators and their weights of a Subnet or the Primary Network at a given P-Chain height.
p-chain.importAVAX: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>Complete a transfer of AVAX from the X-Chain, or C-Chain to the P-Chain.
p-chain.importKey: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>Give a user control over an address by providing the private key that controls the address.
p-chain.issueTx: Issue a transaction to the Platform Chain.
p-chain.listAddresses: ðŸš« This method is not supported!</br>List addresses controlled by the given user.
p-chain.sampleValidators: Sample validators from the specified Subnet.
p-chain.validatedBy: Get the Subnet that validates a given blockchain.
p-chain.validates: Get the IDs of the blockchains a Subnet validates.

nodes-table.empty: There are no nodes to display
nodes-table.tooltip-text: Height, weight and availability of nodes depends on location.

upgrade-banner.message: Faster global infrastructure, WebSockets capability, Dedicated endpoints, Prioritized requests during peak traffic, No request rate limits, & much more.

placeholder.title: Send your request
placeholder.subtitle: Once you start sending requests, your data will be available here. Depending on your usage, you may not have data to show for the past 24 hours or 7 days. This will be populated only if you've made requests in those timeframes.

plan.more-questions: Have more questions? Let's hear them!

header.title: Ship fast, scale and save with Premium features.
header.sub-title: We have just launched the Pay as you Go (PAYG) pricing model. You only pay for what you use. To start using all the premium features, make a minimum deposit of 1000 ANKR tokens to create your account.
header.sub-title2: Limited-time, developer-first pricing that crushes the competition

purchase-block.title: Start using your Premium Plan and pay as you go.
purchase-block.sub-title:
Tons of useful features are on their way — granular stats for your dApps, access control lists, multichain projects and much more.

Btw, if you don’t need premium features anymore, you will be able to claim the unused ANKR tokens back to your wallet.

features-block.feature2: More Requests To Power Your Project
features-block.feature6: Dedicated Endpoints For All Supported Chains
features-block.feature-full1: Provide a constant stream of blockchain data to your application so your applications and platforms can be updated in real-time.
features-block.feature-full2: Scale your application to handle any amount of blockchain requests. Our premium plan serves dApps and platforms of all sizes.
features-block.feature-full3: See all on-chain activity and stay up to date on network activity with our analytics tools.
features-block.feature-full4: Our infrastructure is ready to serve your needs with lightning-fast and reliable returns no matter your location. Ankr removes the need for developers to run their own blockchain nodes, freeing up more time and money to focus on building!
features-block.feature-full5: Ankr Protocol will always prioritize our Premium users to ensure they receive every resource they need to develop and connect with chains.
features-block.feature-full6: Access to dedicated endpoints ensures that your project always has node resources to power it at the highest level of performance.  Build easier on any network with multi-chain infrastructure ready to handle any applicationâ€™s needs.

table.archive-data-info: Developers can access and query on-chain information stretching all the way back to the genesis block.
table.advanced-api-info: Our Advanced API enables simultaneous data querying across multiple chains, allowing developers to build faster with fewer requests.
table.high-traffic-info: During peak RPC traffic times, public users are rate-limited to prioritize Premium users with node resources.
table.rate-limit-info: Rate limits cap the amount of request traffic on the public RPC to keep node resources balanced and available to all.
table.row4-col2: Soft limit of 1M requests per day
table.global-coverage: Global node coverage for low  latency

agreement.text: I understand that my wallet app will deposit these tokens and I will incur a gas fee. The deposit is non-refundable. Ankr cannot assist with lost passwords for wallet apps.

security.tooltip-text: Ensure the integrity of your requests by adding an extra layer of security with the domain (url referer or origin header) and IP address allowlist.

user-endpoints.title: My Endpoints
user-endpoints.tooltip: Will be prioritized ahead of Premium Nodes when serving traffic.

add-endpoint.description: You can import your personal endpoint, which will be used to process requests that are sent to your exclusive ANKR endpoint. In case of an error, the request will be processed by our nodes for premium users. Please enter a valid https endpoint address and the system will check it.

add-step.title: Add your Email
add-step.description: Get 100M Bonus API Credits by adding your email.

success-step.title: Thank you!

payment-table.title: Payments History
payment-table.empty: No data for the selected filter parameters.

card-payment-success.title: Everything looks good!
card-payment-success.description: After Ethereum network validation you will see your updated wallet balance and Premium Endpoints. Usual waiting time is â‰ˆ15 min.

card-payment-failure.title: Something going wrong!
card-payment-failure.description: Please try again later or contact our support team.

step-content.0: I understand my wallet will make a top-up that includes a gas fee. Ankr cannot provide assistance if I lose access to my wallet and the associated account.
step-content.1: Click Confirm and allow us to use your {amount} ANKR in Metamask extension.
step-content.2: Click Confirm and allow us to spend your {amount} ANKR in Metamask extension.
step-content.3-error: Oops! Transaction has not been completed.
step-content.4: Finally, click Done and decrypt the message in Metamask extension.

step-notice.2: If you changed your mind, click Cancel and give us permission to access your Ankr again so we could revoke your Top Up
step-notice.3: After Ethereum network validation you will see updated balance of your wallet.
step-notice.3-error: Donâ€™t worry, your funds are safe. Just try again.
step-notice.4: The last step in your top up process.

withdraw-steps.title: Withdraw
withdraw-steps.disabled-content: We’ve pegged the price of our API Credits to USD. For now, with regards to withdrawals, it means that they are to be requested via Support only.

step-content.0: I understand my withdrawal could be less after any pending charges are subtracted. The processing time will depend on the Ethereum network load.
step-content.1: How much would you like to withdraw?
step-content.2: Thank you! Transaction is on the way.
step-content.2-error: Oops! Transaction has not been completed.

step-notice.2: After 12 block validations, our system will perform the final calculation. This may take up to 15 minutes
step-notice.2-error: Donâ€™t worry, your funds are safe. Just try again.
step-notice.3: It will take up to 15 minutes for our system to finish the calculation. You can leave this page now.

form.balance-error: You cannot make a withdrawal as your balance is zero or negative
form.min: The minimum withdrawal amount is {value} ANKR
form.max: You cannot make a withdrawal, as your balance is less than {value} ANKR
form.excess: The entered amount exceeds your balance
form.credits-info: Voucher credits are also used for payment. They are equivalent to ordinary credits but cannot be withdrawn in ANKR tokens.
